      • groupBy

        public <Group> Stream<T> groupBy(scala.Function1<T,Group> fun,
                        int parallelism,
                        java.lang.String description)
        Group by fun(T)

        For example, we have T type, People(name: String, gender: String, age: Int) groupBy[People](_.gender) will group the people by gender.

        You can append other combinators after groupBy

        For example,

        Stream[People].groupBy(_.gender).flatmap(..).filter.(..).reduce(..)

        Type Parameters:
        Group - the group type
        Parameters:
        fun - group by function
        parallelism - parallelism level
        description - the description
        Returns:
        the grouped stream

      • process

        public <R> Stream<R> process(java.lang.Class<? extends Task> processor,
                    int parallism,
                    io.gearpump.cluster.UserConfig conf,
                    java.lang.String description)
        connect with a low level Processor(TaskDescription)
        Type Parameters:
        R - the result message type
        Parameters:
        processor - a user defined processor
        parallelism - parallelism level
        parallism - (undocumented)
        conf - (undocumented)
        description - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        new stream after processing with type [R]
